item.value: The earth is the 3rd planet from the sun and is the 5th largest planet in our solar system.
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It is about 38 million kilometers away. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
The banana tree is not actually a tree, it is a herb. It bears fruit once a year and then dies.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
The biggest earthquake ever recorded occurred in Chile, in 1960. It measured 9.5 on the Richter scale.

Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876. By 2008 there were almost 1.3 billions land lines in the world. China had more than 350 million phones, more than any other country.
The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. Cheetahs can run much faster than people.

The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
Drinking too much water too quickly can lead to water intoxication which causes an imbalance of water in the brain
About two thirds of the Earth's surface is covered with water.
The Earth orbits the Sun at an average speed of 29.79 km/s ( 67,000 miles/hour).
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. The second largest animal is the Afican elephant.
Sound travels at a speed of around 767 miles per hour (1,230 kilometres per hour).
The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in Japan and died a week before her 115th birthday.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
John Logie Baird was the inventor of the world's first working television system in Hastings, England in 1923.

The Spine-tailed Swift is the fastest bird. It can fly at 170 kilometres per hour (105mph). The Peregrine Falcon is the fastest bird that dives headfirst down through the sky. They can travel at up to 200mph.
The original Olympic Games were a series of athletic competitions held in Ancient Greece.
The 1921 Nobel Prize in Physics was won by Albert Einstein for his work in the field of theoretical physics.
